column4: cary : cary adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner crontab
Sorry, user cary may not run sudo on localhost.
you aren't in the admin group, strange. the admin group is what gives you sudo access
dude. i have not done a damn thing. i installed. thats it.
I've never heard of that happening, very weird
well pastebin it and I'll take a look
on your system, group id 106 is crontab, on mine, crontab is 107 and admin is 106. That is your problem
You're going to need to reboot again so that you can edit /etc/group. Change 106 on the admin line to be 113
you should have typed sudo -l before rebooting to make sure it was fixed :)
now...what did i need to open to add my res?
okay i have the file open ..should i just add "1920x1440" to the res lists?
